intro: Pantorrhynchus, commonly known as the common buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with five petals and a central cluster of stamens. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments such as meadows and woodlands. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the stems are usually hairy. Pantorrhynchus plays an important role in pollination and serves as a food source for various insects and small animals.
